author: Pavan Dahat
text:
In a jibe at the JNU row over the alleged anti-national slogans raised on campus, Rashtriya Swayamsevek Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Thursday that there were “people” these days “who have to be told to praise their motherland.”

In his speech at a meeting in Nagpur, Mr Bhagwat however, did not name the university.

“The time has come that Bharat Mata Ki Jai [Hail Mother India] has to be taught to some people of this generation. It should be inherent and natural. But these things are to be told these days because we have people [the students] who told not to say this [ Bharat Mata Ki Jay ]. Such people are more visible today and it is time for us to think about it,” he said in an apparent reference to the arrest of some JNU students for allegedly raising anti-national slogans.
title: RSS chief takes a dig at JNU students
